Reviews.Title: Phone died when left off charge and could not contact seller
Reviews.Author: Gou Rao
Reviews.Content: The product itself was OK... the phone died, this happens to electronics, but I could not contact BLUTEKUSA who sold me the phone.  After a while of trying, the warranty expired anyway.  When I bought the phone, they sent a thank you email, and the contact address they had in that email would not work.I tried to contact them because I left the phone uncharged for a week, and when I came back to use it, it simply would not turn on.  I tried everything, plugging it into the wall, trying the sony s/w ... the phone is simply dead.Buy from a carrier and pay the extra money if you want the service you deserve.

Reviews.Title: Old and small, but very good
Reviews.Author: A Customer "customer12345657"
Reviews.Content: It has an old version of android, and the screen is small, so you don't get as many home screen options (one widget per page, and 4 static shortcuts).BUT...1. Thanks to the small screen and slower processor, the battery lasts about twice as long as newer phones.  This is a good option if you want a longer-lasting battery as a tiny vacation phone, but don't want to give up some of your critical Android apps.2. The camera is much better than most phones.  Sony phones have always had superior cameras.  Much better auto focus, and less noise in the image.  It also has the ability to take clear macro pictures at only a couple inches, which most phones are not good at.  Shutter response is pretty good, and it has an actual 2-stage camera button.  Many phones have no camera button at all (requiring use of an on-screen button, which is clumsy), and far fewer have a pre-focus option.3. Good sound quality through the headphone jack.  This is another area where many "good" phones are happy to do poorly, but once again Sony is music-focused.4. Better sound quality through the ringer and earpiece than most low-cost phones.Note: If this phone only works on your carrier's EDGE network (non-3g), use Opera Mini as your browser and set the image quality to low.  Opera compresses websites, and this display has no use for medium/high images anyway.  With this setup, I didn't even notice the EDGE data speed during normal browsing.

Reviews.Title: Great phone in a small package
Reviews.Author: mystuff "mystuff"
Reviews.Content: The Sony Xperia Mini is very much like its bigger brother, the full size Xperia X10.  This phone is small but mighty. Has a great 5mp camera and wifi as well.  Call quality is good, volume for listening to tunes is good as well. Has a built in FM radio tuner as well as the standard apps like calendar, alarms, etc. Also has the android market app so you can download and install more programs.The screen is full touch and is responsive. The on screen keyboard is ok but you can always download other keyboards from the app store if the one that comes on the phone is not your style.  Very happy with the phone and its reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars, but still less than perfect
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: the phone is great, small but amazing. lack of a qwerty keyboard didnt present much of a problem thanks to android market apps. HOWEVER, the package did NOT include the 2GB micro sd card as advertised. other than that, its perfect, but still tiny (2x3 inches!!) smallest device in the world capable of recording hd video. battery life is ok not great, lasts fairly long. touch screen is very responsive and the android os 2.1 interface is very good. overall am very happy
